Option: filesystem.rootpath

This option is the default root path for the MCFileManager the user may not go below this point in the directory structure.

If you for example try to access the following dir "/somedir1" with a root path of "/somedir1/somedir2" a hack attempt message will be displayed, this message will normally not appear since the user can't access directories below the root point. Notice this path can be relative or absolute.

You may also have multiple root paths in this option, this will fake a root level directory stucture with viritual named directories.

Example of usage in the config.php file:

$mcFileManagerConfig['filesystem.rootpath'] = "/somedir1/somedir2";

Example of a named root path:

$mcFileManagerConfig['filesystem.rootpath'] = "SomeName=/somedir1/somedir2";

Example of usage of multiple root paths:

$mcFileManagerConfig['filesystem.rootpath'] = "SomeName=/somedir1/somedir2;SomeOther=/somedir1/someotherdir2";
